alert.note: Alert for Coastal St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:12AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central St. Johns County through 200 AM EDT... At 111 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Vilano Beach, or near Saint Augustine, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Saint Augustine, Saint Augustine Beach, Saint Augustine Shores, Butler Beach, Vilano Beach, Saint Augustine South, Crescent Beach, Anastasia and Dupont Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
